libMesh::Mesh类 参考abstract

The Mesh class is a thin wrapper, around the ReplicatedMesh class by default. 更多...

#include <mesh.h>

类 libMesh::Mesh 继承关系图:
[图例]

virtual void own_node (Node &n) overridefinal
 Takes ownership of node n on this partition of a distributed mesh, by setting n.processor_id() to this->processor_id(), as well as changing n.id() and moving it in the mesh's internal container to give it a new authoritative id. 更多...

bool operator== (const MeshBase &other_mesh) const
 This tests for exactly-equal data in all the senses that a mathematician would care about (element connectivity, nodal coordinates), but in the senses a programmer would care about it allows for non-equal equivalence in some ways (we accept different Elem/Node addresses in memory) but not others (we do not accept different subclass types, nor even different Elem/Node ids). 更多...

void skip_noncritical_partitioning (bool skip)
 If true is passed in then the elements on this mesh will no longer be (re)partitioned, and the nodes on this mesh will only be repartitioned if they are found "orphaned" via coarsening or other removal of the last element responsible for their node/element processor id consistency. 更多...

详细描述

The Mesh class is a thin wrapper, around the ReplicatedMesh class by default.

作者
Benjamin S. Kirk
日期
2002 Manages a collection of Nodes and Elems.

在文件 mesh.h 第 50 行定义.

在文件 mesh_base.h 第 2032 行定义.

typedef std::set<elemset_id_type> libMesh::MeshBase::elemset_type
inherited

Typedef for the "set" container used to store elemset ids.

The main requirements are that the entries be sorted and unique, so std::set works for this, but there may be more efficient alternatives.

构造及析构函数说明

libMesh::Mesh::Mesh ( const Parallel::Communicator &  comm_in,
unsigned char  dim = 1 
)
inlineexplicit

Constructor.

Takes dim, the dimension of the mesh. The mesh dimension can be changed (and may automatically be changed by mesh generation/loading) later.

在文件 distributed_mesh.h 第 368 行定义.

参考 libMesh::DistributedMesh::ss.

368 { return active_subdomain_set_element_ptr_range(ss); }
libMesh::DistributedMesh::ss
unsigned int level ElemType type std::set< subdomain_id_type > ss
Definition: distributed_mesh.h:360
Elem * libMesh::DistributedMesh::add_elem ( Elem *  e)
finaloverridevirtualinherited

Add elem e to the end of the element array.

To add an element locally, set e->processor_id() before adding it. To ensure a specific element id, call e->set_id() before adding it; only do this in parallel if you are manually keeping ids consistent.

Users should call MeshBase::prepare_for_use() after elements are added to and/or deleted from the mesh.

实现了 libMesh::MeshBase.

在文件 distributed_mesh.C 第 532 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_elem_integer_default_values, libMesh::MeshBase::_elem_integer_names, libMesh::DistributedMesh::_elements, libMesh::DistributedMesh::_max_elem_id, libMesh::DistributedMesh::_n_elem, libMesh::DistributedMesh::_next_free_local_elem_id, libMesh::DistributedMesh::_next_free_unpartitioned_elem_id, libMesh::MeshBase::_next_unique_id, libMesh::DistributedMesh::_next_unpartitioned_unique_id, libMesh::DofObject::add_extra_integers(), libMesh::MeshBase::default_mapping_data(), libMesh::MeshBase::default_mapping_type(), libMesh::DofObject::id(), libMesh::DofObject::invalid_processor_id, libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::ParallelObject::n_processors(), libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::DofObject::processor_id(), libMesh::DofObject::set_id(), libMesh::Elem::set_mapping_data(), libMesh::Elem::set_mapping_type(), libMesh::DofObject::set_unique_id(), libMesh::DofObject::unique_id(), libMesh::DofObject::valid_id() , 以及 libMesh::DofObject::valid_unique_id().

参考自 libMesh::DistributedMesh::add_elem() , 以及 libMesh::DistributedMesh::add_extra_ghost_elem().

533 {
534  // Don't try to add nullptrs!
535  libmesh_assert(e);
536 
537  // Trying to add an existing element is a no-op
538  if (e->valid_id() && _elements[e->id()] == e)
539  return e;
540 
541  const processor_id_type elem_procid = e->processor_id();
542 
543  if (!e->valid_id())
544  {
545  // We should only be creating new ids past the end of the range
546  // of existing ids
547  libmesh_assert_greater_equal(_next_free_unpartitioned_elem_id,
548  _max_elem_id);
549  libmesh_assert_greater_equal(_next_free_local_elem_id, _max_elem_id);
550 
551  // Use the unpartitioned ids for unpartitioned elems, and
552  // temporarily for ghost elems
553  dof_id_type * next_id = &_next_free_unpartitioned_elem_id;
554  if (elem_procid == this->processor_id())
555  next_id = &_next_free_local_elem_id;
556  e->set_id (*next_id);
557  }
558 
559  {
560  // Advance next_ids up high enough that each is pointing to an
561  // unused id and any subsequent increments will still point us
562  // to unused ids
563  _max_elem_id = std::max(_max_elem_id,
564  static_cast<dof_id_type>(e->id()+1));
565 
566  if (_next_free_unpartitioned_elem_id < _max_elem_id)
567  _next_free_unpartitioned_elem_id =
568  ((_max_elem_id-1) / (this->n_processors() + 1) + 1) *
569  (this->n_processors() + 1) + this->n_processors();
570  if (_next_free_local_elem_id < _max_elem_id)
571  _next_free_local_elem_id =
572  ((_max_elem_id + this->n_processors() - 1) / (this->n_processors() + 1) + 1) *
573  (this->n_processors() + 1) + this->processor_id();
574 
575 #ifndef NDEBUG
576  // We need a const dofobject_container so we don't inadvertently create
577  // nullptr entries when testing for non-nullptr ones
578  const dofobject_container<Elem> & const_elements = _elements;
579 #endif
580  libmesh_assert(!const_elements[_next_free_unpartitioned_elem_id]);
581  libmesh_assert(!const_elements[_next_free_local_elem_id]);
582  }
583 
584  // Don't try to overwrite existing elems
585  libmesh_assert (!_elements[e->id()]);
586 
587  _elements[e->id()] = e;
588 
589  // Try to make the cached elem data more accurate
590  if (elem_procid == this->processor_id() ||
591  elem_procid == DofObject::invalid_processor_id)
592  _n_elem++;
593 
594 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
595  if (!e->valid_unique_id())
596  {
597  if (processor_id() == e->processor_id())
598  {
599  e->set_unique_id(_next_unique_id);
600  _next_unique_id += this->n_processors() + 1;
601  }
602  else
603  {
604  e->set_unique_id(_next_unpartitioned_unique_id);
605  _next_unpartitioned_unique_id += this->n_processors() + 1;
606  }
607  }
608  else
609  {
610  _next_unique_id = std::max(_next_unique_id, e->unique_id()+1);
611  _next_unique_id =
612  ((_next_unique_id + this->n_processors() - 1) / (this->n_processors() + 1) + 1) *
613  (this->n_processors() + 1) + this->processor_id();
614  }
615 #endif
616 
617  // Unpartitioned elems should be added on every processor
618  // And shouldn't be added in the same batch as ghost elems
619  // But we might be just adding on processor 0 to
620  // broadcast later
621  // #ifdef DEBUG
622  // if (elem_procid == DofObject::invalid_processor_id)
623  // {
624  // dof_id_type elem_id = e->id();
625  // this->comm().max(elem_id);
626  // libmesh_assert_equal_to (elem_id, e->id());
627  // }
628  // #endif
629 
630  // Make sure any new element is given space for any extra integers
631  // we've requested
632  e->add_extra_integers(_elem_integer_names.size(),
633  _elem_integer_default_values);
634 
635  // And set mapping type and data on any new element
636  e->set_mapping_type(this->default_mapping_type());
637  e->set_mapping_data(this->default_mapping_data());
638 
639  return e;
640 }

Definition: distributed_mesh.h:457

dof_id_type _next_free_local_elem_id

Elem * libMesh::DistributedMesh::add_elem ( std::unique_ptr< Elem >  e)
finaloverridevirtualinherited

Version of add_elem() taking a std::unique_ptr by value.

The version taking a dumb pointer will eventually be deprecated in favor of this version. This API is intended to indicate that ownership of the Elem is transferred to the Mesh when this function is called, and it should play more nicely with the Elem::build() API which has always returned a std::unique_ptr.

实现了 libMesh::MeshBase.

在文件 distributed_mesh.C 第 644 行定义.

参考 libMesh::DistributedMesh::add_elem().

645 {
646  // The mesh now takes ownership of the Elem. Eventually the guts of
647  // add_elem() will get moved to a private helper function, and
648  // calling add_elem() directly will be deprecated.
649  return add_elem(e.release());
650 }
libMesh::DistributedMesh::add_elem
virtual Elem * add_elem(Elem *e) overridefinal
Add elem e to the end of the element array.
Definition: distributed_mesh.C:532
template<typename T >
std::vector< unsigned int > libMesh::MeshBase::add_elem_data ( const std::vector< std::string > &  names,
bool  allocate_data = true,
const std::vector< T > *  default_values = nullptr 
)
inlineinherited

Register data (of type T) to be added to each element in the mesh.

If the mesh already has elements, data is allocated in each.

Newly allocated values for the new datum with name names[i] will be initialized to default_values[i], or to meaningless memcpy output if default_values is null.

返回
The starting index number for the new data, or for the existing data if one by the same name has already been added.

If type T is larger than dof_id_type, each datum will end up spanning multiple index values, but will be queried with the starting index number.

No type checking is done with this function! If you add data of type T, don't try to access it with a call specifying type U.

在文件 mesh_base.h 第 2186 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_elem_integer_names, libMesh::index_range(), libMesh::libmesh_assert() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::size_elem_extra_integers().

2189 {
2190  libmesh_assert(!default_values || default_values->size() == names.size());
2191 
2192  std::vector<unsigned int> returnval(names.size());
2193 
2194  const std::size_t old_size = _elem_integer_names.size();
2195 
2196  for (auto i : index_range(names))
2197  returnval[i] =
2198  this->add_elem_datum<T>(names[i], false,
2199  default_values ?
2200  (*default_values)[i] : nullptr);
2201 
2202  if (allocate_data && old_size != _elem_integer_names.size())
2203  this->size_elem_extra_integers();
2204 
2205  return returnval;
2206 }

Definition: int_range.h:111
libMesh::MeshBase::size_elem_extra_integers
void size_elem_extra_integers()
Size extra-integer arrays of all elements in the mesh.
Definition: mesh_base.C:1836
template<typename T >
unsigned int libMesh::MeshBase::add_elem_datum ( const std::string &  name,
bool  allocate_data = true,
const T *  default_value = nullptr 
)
inlineinherited

Register a datum (of type T) to be added to each element in the mesh.

If the mesh already has elements, data by default is allocated in each of them. This may be expensive to do repeatedly; use add_elem_data instead. Alternatively, the allocate_data option can be manually set to false, but if this is done then a manual call to size_elem_extra_integers() will need to be done before the new space is usable.

Newly allocated values for the new datum will be initialized to *default_value if default_value is not null, or to meaningless memcpy output otherwise.

返回
The index numbers for the new data, and/or for existing data if data by some of the same names has already been added.

If type T is larger than dof_id_type, its data will end up spanning multiple index values, but will be queried with the starting index number.

No type checking is done with this function! If you add data of type T, don't try to access it with a call specifying type U.

在文件 mesh_base.h 第 2162 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_elem_integer_names, libMesh::MeshBase::add_elem_integer(), libMesh::DofObject::invalid_id , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::size_elem_extra_integers().

2165 {
2166  const std::size_t old_size = _elem_integer_names.size();
2167 
2168  unsigned int n_more_integers = (sizeof(T)-1)/sizeof(dof_id_type);
2169  std::vector<dof_id_type> int_data(n_more_integers+1, DofObject::invalid_id);
2170  if (default_value)
2171  std::memcpy(int_data.data(), default_value, sizeof(T));
2172 
2173  unsigned int start_idx = this->add_elem_integer(name, false, int_data[0]);
2174  for (unsigned int i=0; i != n_more_integers; ++i)
2175  this->add_elem_integer(name+"__"+std::to_string(i), false, int_data[i+1]);
2176 
2177  if (allocate_data && old_size != _elem_integer_names.size())
2178  this->size_elem_extra_integers();
2179 
2180  return start_idx;
2181 }

unsigned int libMesh::MeshBase::add_elem_integer ( std::string  name,
bool  allocate_data = true,
dof_id_type  default_value = DofObject::invalid_id 
)
inherited

Register an integer datum (of type dof_id_type) to be added to each element in the mesh.

If the mesh already has elements, data by default is allocated in each of them. This may be expensive to do repeatedly; use add_elem_integers instead. Alternatively, the allocate_data option can be manually set to false, but if this is done then a manual call to size_elem_extra_integers() will need to be done before the new space is usable.

Newly allocated values for the new datum will be initialized to default_value

返回
The index number for the new datum, or for the existing datum if one by the same name has already been added.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 510 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_elem_integer_default_values, libMesh::MeshBase::_elem_integer_names, libMesh::index_range() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::size_elem_extra_integers().

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::add_elem_datum(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::add_elements(), libMesh::ExodusII_IO::read() , 以及 libMesh::CheckpointIO::read_header().

513 {
514  for (auto i : index_range(_elem_integer_names))
515  if (_elem_integer_names[i] == name)
516  {
517  libmesh_assert_less(i, _elem_integer_default_values.size());
518  _elem_integer_default_values[i] = default_value;
519  return i;
520  }
521 
522  libmesh_assert_equal_to(_elem_integer_names.size(),
523  _elem_integer_default_values.size());
524  _elem_integer_names.push_back(std::move(name));
525  _elem_integer_default_values.push_back(default_value);
526  if (allocate_data)
527  this->size_elem_extra_integers();
528  return _elem_integer_names.size()-1;
529 }

std::vector< unsigned int > libMesh::MeshBase::add_elem_integers ( const std::vector< std::string > &  names,
bool  allocate_data = true,
const std::vector< dof_id_type > *  default_values = nullptr 
)
inherited

Register integer data (of type dof_id_type) to be added to each element in the mesh, one string name for each new integer.

If the mesh already has elements, data by default is allocated in each of them.

Newly allocated values for the new datum with name names[i] will be initialized to default_values[i], or to DofObject::invalid_id if default_values is null.

返回
The index numbers for the new data, and/or for existing data if data by some of the same names has already been added.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 533 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_elem_integer_default_values, libMesh::MeshBase::_elem_integer_names, libMesh::index_range(), libMesh::DofObject::invalid_id, libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::Quality::name() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::size_elem_extra_integers().

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::merge_extra_integer_names() , 以及 libMesh::XdrIO::read_header().

536 {
537  libmesh_assert(!default_values || default_values->size() == names.size());
538  libmesh_assert_equal_to(_elem_integer_names.size(), _elem_integer_default_values.size());
539 
540  std::unordered_map<std::string, std::size_t> name_indices;
541  for (auto i : index_range(_elem_integer_names))
542  name_indices[_elem_integer_names[i]] = i;
543 
544  std::vector<unsigned int> returnval(names.size());
545 
546  bool added_an_integer = false;
547  for (auto i : index_range(names))
548  {
549  const std::string & name = names[i];
550  auto it = name_indices.find(name);
551  if (it != name_indices.end())
552  {
553  returnval[i] = it->second;
554  _elem_integer_default_values[it->second] =
555  default_values ? (*default_values)[i] : DofObject::invalid_id;
556  }
557  else
558  {
559  returnval[i] = _elem_integer_names.size();
560  name_indices[name] = returnval[i];
561  _elem_integer_names.push_back(name);
562  _elem_integer_default_values.push_back
563  (default_values ? (*default_values)[i] : DofObject::invalid_id);
564  added_an_integer = true;
565  }
566  }
567 
568  if (allocate_data && added_an_integer)
569  this->size_elem_extra_integers();
570 
571  return returnval;
572 }

Definition: mesh_base.C:1836
void libMesh::MeshBase::add_elemset_code ( dof_id_type  code,
MeshBase::elemset_type  id_set 
)
inherited

Tabulate a user-defined "code" for elements which belong to the element sets specified in id_set.

For example, suppose that we have two elemsets A and B with the following Elem ids: Elemset A = {1, 3} Elemset B = {2, 3}

This implies the following mapping from elem id to elemset id: Elem 1 -> {A} Elem 2 -> {B} Elem 3 -> {A,B}

In this case, we would need to tabulate three different elemset codes, e.g.: 0 -> {A} 1 -> {B} 2 -> {A,B}

Also sets up the inverse mapping, so that if one knows all the element sets an Elem belongs to, one can look up the corresponding elemset code.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 348 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_all_elemset_ids, libMesh::MeshBase::_elemset_codes , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::_elemset_codes_inverse_map.

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::change_elemset_code(), libMesh::ExodusII_IO::read(), libMesh::XdrIO::read_header() , 以及 libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::stitching_helper().

349 {
350  // Populate inverse map, stealing id_set's resources
351  auto [it1, inserted1] = _elemset_codes_inverse_map.emplace(std::move(id_set), code);
352 
353  // Reference to the newly inserted (or previously existing) id_set
354  const auto & inserted_id_set = it1->first;
355 
356  // Keep track of all elemset ids ever added for O(1) n_elemsets()
357  // performance. Only need to do this if we didn't know about this
358  // id_set before...
359  if (inserted1)
360  _all_elemset_ids.insert(inserted_id_set.begin(), inserted_id_set.end());
361 
362  // Take the address of the newly emplaced set to use in
363  // _elemset_codes, avoid duplicating std::set storage
364  auto [it2, inserted2] = _elemset_codes.emplace(code, &inserted_id_set);
365 
366  // Throw an error if this code already exists with a pointer to a
367  // different set of ids.
368  libmesh_error_msg_if(!inserted2 && it2->second != &inserted_id_set,
369  "The elemset code " << code << " already exists with a different id_set.");
370 }

void libMesh::DistributedMesh::add_extra_ghost_elem ( Elem *  e)
virtualinherited

Inserts the element and adds it to a list of elements that should not get deleted or have their descendants deleted by delete_remote_elements.

This is handy for inserting otherwise off-processor elements that you want to keep track of on this processor.

Definition: distributed_mesh.C:532
void libMesh::MeshBase::add_ghosting_functor ( GhostingFunctor &  ghosting_functor)
inlineinherited

Adds a functor which can specify ghosting requirements for use on distributed meshes.

Multiple ghosting functors can be added; any element which is required by any functor will be ghosted.

GhostingFunctor memory must be managed by the code which calls this function; the GhostingFunctor lifetime is expected to extend until either the functor is removed or the Mesh is destructed.

在文件 mesh_base.h 第 1240 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_ghosting_functors.

参考自 libMesh::DofMap::add_algebraic_ghosting_functor(), libMesh::DofMap::add_coupling_functor(), libMesh::MeshBase::add_ghosting_functor(), libMesh::EquationSystems::enable_default_ghosting() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::MeshBase().

1241  { _ghosting_functors.insert(&ghosting_functor); }
libMesh::MeshBase::_ghosting_functors
std::set< GhostingFunctor * > _ghosting_functors
The list of all GhostingFunctor objects to be used when distributing a DistributedMesh.
Definition: mesh_base.h:1956
void libMesh::MeshBase::add_ghosting_functor ( std::shared_ptr< GhostingFunctor >  ghosting_functor)
inlineinherited

Adds a functor which can specify ghosting requirements for use on distributed meshes.

Multiple ghosting functors can be added; any element which is required by any functor will be ghosted.

GhostingFunctor memory when using this method is managed by the shared_ptr mechanism.

Node * libMesh::DistributedMesh::add_node ( Node *  n)
finaloverridevirtualinherited

Add Node n to the end of the vertex array.

实现了 libMesh::MeshBase.

在文件 distributed_mesh.C 第 799 行定义.

参考 libMesh::DistributedMesh::_max_node_id, libMesh::DistributedMesh::_n_nodes, libMesh::DistributedMesh::_next_free_local_node_id, libMesh::DistributedMesh::_next_free_unpartitioned_node_id, libMesh::MeshBase::_next_unique_id, libMesh::DistributedMesh::_next_unpartitioned_unique_id, libMesh::MeshBase::_node_integer_default_values, libMesh::MeshBase::_node_integer_names, libMesh::DistributedMesh::_nodes, libMesh::DofObject::add_extra_integers(), libMesh::DofObject::id(), libMesh::DofObject::invalid_processor_id, libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::ParallelObject::n_processors(), libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::DofObject::processor_id(), libMesh::DofObject::set_id(), libMesh::DofObject::set_unique_id(), libMesh::DofObject::unique_id(), libMesh::DofObject::valid_id() , 以及 libMesh::DofObject::valid_unique_id().

参考自 libMesh::DistributedMesh::add_node(), libMesh::DistributedMesh::add_point(), libMesh::DistributedMesh::insert_node() , 以及 libMesh::DistributedMesh::own_node().

800 {
801  // Don't try to add nullptrs!
802  libmesh_assert(n);
803 
804  // Trying to add an existing node is a no-op
805  if (n->valid_id() && _nodes[n->id()] == n)
806  return n;
807 
808  const processor_id_type node_procid = n->processor_id();
809 
810  if (!n->valid_id())
811  {
812  // We should only be creating new ids past the end of the range
813  // of existing ids
814  libmesh_assert_greater_equal(_next_free_unpartitioned_node_id,
815  _max_node_id);
816  libmesh_assert_greater_equal(_next_free_local_node_id, _max_node_id);
817 
818  // Use the unpartitioned ids for unpartitioned nodes,
819  // and temporarily for ghost nodes
820  dof_id_type * next_id = &_next_free_unpartitioned_node_id;
821  if (node_procid == this->processor_id())
822  next_id = &_next_free_local_node_id;
823  n->set_id (*next_id);
824  }
825 
826  {
827  // Advance next_ids up high enough that each is pointing to an
828  // unused id and any subsequent increments will still point us
829  // to unused ids
830  _max_node_id = std::max(_max_node_id,
831  static_cast<dof_id_type>(n->id()+1));
832 
833  if (_next_free_unpartitioned_node_id < _max_node_id)
834  _next_free_unpartitioned_node_id =
835  ((_max_node_id-1) / (this->n_processors() + 1) + 1) *
836  (this->n_processors() + 1) + this->n_processors();
837  if (_next_free_local_node_id < _max_node_id)
838  _next_free_local_node_id =
839  ((_max_node_id + this->n_processors() - 1) / (this->n_processors() + 1) + 1) *
840  (this->n_processors() + 1) + this->processor_id();
841 
842 #ifndef NDEBUG
843  // We need a const dofobject_container so we don't inadvertently create
844  // nullptr entries when testing for non-nullptr ones
845  const dofobject_container<Node> & const_nodes = _nodes;
846 #endif
847  libmesh_assert(!const_nodes[_next_free_unpartitioned_node_id]);
848  libmesh_assert(!const_nodes[_next_free_local_node_id]);
849  }
850 
851  // Don't try to overwrite existing nodes
852  libmesh_assert (!_nodes[n->id()]);
853 
854  _nodes[n->id()] = n;
855 
856  // Try to make the cached node data more accurate
857  if (node_procid == this->processor_id() ||
858  node_procid == DofObject::invalid_processor_id)
859  _n_nodes++;
860 
861 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
862  if (!n->valid_unique_id())
863  {
864  if (processor_id() == n->processor_id())
865  {
866  n->set_unique_id(_next_unique_id);
867  _next_unique_id += this->n_processors() + 1;
868  }
869  else
870  {
871  n->set_unique_id(_next_unpartitioned_unique_id);
872  _next_unpartitioned_unique_id += this->n_processors() + 1;
873  }
874  }
875  else
876  {
877  _next_unique_id = std::max(_next_unique_id, n->unique_id()+1);
878  _next_unique_id =
879  ((_next_unique_id + this->n_processors() - 1) / (this->n_processors() + 1) + 1) *
880  (this->n_processors() + 1) + this->processor_id();
881  }
882 #endif
883 
884  n->add_extra_integers(_node_integer_names.size(),
885  _node_integer_default_values);
886 
887  // Unpartitioned nodes should be added on every processor
888  // And shouldn't be added in the same batch as ghost nodes
889  // But we might be just adding on processor 0 to
890  // broadcast later
891  // #ifdef DEBUG
892  // if (node_procid == DofObject::invalid_processor_id)
893  // {
894  // dof_id_type node_id = n->id();
895  // this->comm().max(node_id);
896  // libmesh_assert_equal_to (node_id, n->id());
897  // }
898  // #endif
899 
900  return n;
901 }

Node * libMesh::DistributedMesh::add_node ( std::unique_ptr< Node >  n)
finaloverridevirtualinherited

Version of add_node() taking a std::unique_ptr by value.

The version taking a dumb pointer will eventually be deprecated in favor of this version. This API is intended to indicate that ownership of the Node is transferred to the Mesh when this function is called, and it should play more nicely with the Node::build() API which has always returned a std::unique_ptr.

实现了 libMesh::MeshBase.

在文件 distributed_mesh.C 第 903 行定义.

参考 libMesh::DistributedMesh::add_node().

904 {
905  // The mesh now takes ownership of the Node. Eventually the guts of
906  // add_node() will get moved to a private helper function, and
907  // calling add_node() directly will be deprecated.
908  return add_node(n.release());
909 }
libMesh::DistributedMesh::add_node
virtual Node * add_node(Node *n) overridefinal
Add Node n to the end of the vertex array.
Definition: distributed_mesh.C:799
template<typename T >
std::vector< unsigned int > libMesh::MeshBase::add_node_data ( const std::vector< std::string > &  name,
bool  allocate_data = true,
const std::vector< T > *  default_values = nullptr 
)
inlineinherited

Register data (of type T) to be added to each node in the mesh.

If the mesh already has nodes, data by default is allocated in each.

Newly allocated values for the new datum with name names[i] will be initialized to default_values[i], or to meaningless memcpy output if default_values is null.

返回
The starting index number for the new data, or for the existing data if one by the same name has already been added.

If type T is larger than dof_id_type, its data will end up spanning multiple index values, but will be queried with the starting index number.

No type checking is done with this function! If you add data of type T, don't try to access it with a call specifying type U.

在文件 mesh_base.h 第 2235 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_node_integer_names, libMesh::index_range(), libMesh::libmesh_assert() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::size_node_extra_integers().

2238 {
2239  libmesh_assert(!default_values || default_values->size() == names.size());
2240 
2241  std::vector<unsigned int> returnval(names.size());
2242 
2243  const std::size_t old_size = _node_integer_names.size();
2244 
2245  for (auto i : index_range(names))
2246  returnval[i] =
2247  this->add_node_datum<T>(names[i], false,
2248  default_values ?
2249  (*default_values)[i] : nullptr);
2250 
2251  if (allocate_data && old_size != _node_integer_names.size())
2252  this->size_node_extra_integers();
2253 
2254  return returnval;
2255 }
libMesh::MeshBase::_node_integer_names

The array of names for integer data associated with each node in the mesh.

libMesh::libmesh_assert

libMesh::MeshBase::size_node_extra_integers
void size_node_extra_integers()
Size extra-integer arrays of all nodes in the mesh.
Definition: mesh_base.C:1845
libMesh::index_range
auto index_range(const T &sizable)
Helper function that returns an IntRange&lt;std::size_t&gt; representing all the indices of the passed-in v...
Definition: int_range.h:111
template<typename T >
unsigned int libMesh::MeshBase::add_node_datum ( const std::string &  name,
bool  allocate_data = true,
const T *  default_value = nullptr 
)
inlineinherited

Register a datum (of type T) to be added to each node in the mesh.

If the mesh already has nodes, data by default is allocated in each of them. This may be expensive to do repeatedly; use add_node_data instead. Alternatively, the allocate_data option can be manually set to false, but if this is done then a manual call to size_node_extra_integers() will need to be done before the new space is usable.

Newly allocated values for the new datum will be initialized to *default_value if default_value is not null, or to meaningless memcpy output otherwise.

返回
The starting index number for the new datum, or for the existing datum if one by the same name has already been added.

If type T is larger than dof_id_type, its data will end up spanning multiple index values, but will be queried with the starting index number.

No type checking is done with this function! If you add data of type T, don't try to access it with a call specifying type U.

在文件 mesh_base.h 第 2211 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_node_integer_names, libMesh::MeshBase::add_node_integer(), libMesh::DofObject::invalid_id , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::size_node_extra_integers().

参考自 libMesh::ExodusII_IO::read() , 以及 libMesh::DynaIO::read_mesh().

2214 {
2215  const std::size_t old_size = _node_integer_names.size();
2216 
2217  unsigned int n_more_integers = (sizeof(T)-1)/sizeof(dof_id_type);
2218  std::vector<dof_id_type> int_data(n_more_integers+1, DofObject::invalid_id);
2219  if (default_value)
2220  std::memcpy(int_data.data(), default_value, sizeof(T));
2221 
2222  unsigned int start_idx = this->add_node_integer(name, false, int_data[0]);
2223  for (unsigned int i=0; i != n_more_integers; ++i)
2224  this->add_node_integer(name+"__"+std::to_string(i), false, int_data[i+1]);
2225 
2226  if (allocate_data && old_size != _node_integer_names.size())
2227  this->size_node_extra_integers();
2228 
2229  return start_idx;
2230 }

libMesh::MeshBase::add_node_integer
unsigned int add_node_integer(std::string name, bool allocate_data=true, dof_id_type default_value=DofObject::invalid_id)
Register an integer datum (of type dof_id_type) to be added to each node in the mesh.
Definition: mesh_base.C:599
libMesh::dof_id_type
uint8_t dof_id_type
Definition: id_types.h:67
unsigned int libMesh::MeshBase::add_node_integer ( std::string  name,
bool  allocate_data = true,
dof_id_type  default_value = DofObject::invalid_id 
)
inherited

Register an integer datum (of type dof_id_type) to be added to each node in the mesh.

If the mesh already has nodes, data by default is allocated in each of them. This may be expensive to do repeatedly; use add_node_integers instead. Alternatively, the allocate_data option can be manually set to false, but if this is done then a manual call to size_node_extra_integers() will need to be done before the new space is usable.

Newly allocated values for the new datum will be initialized to default_value

返回
The index number for the new datum, or for the existing datum if one by the same name has already been added.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 599 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_node_integer_default_values, libMesh::MeshBase::_node_integer_names, libMesh::index_range() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::size_node_extra_integers().

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::add_node_datum() , 以及 libMesh::CheckpointIO::read_header().

602 {
603  for (auto i : index_range(_node_integer_names))
604  if (_node_integer_names[i] == name)
605  {
606  libmesh_assert_less(i, _node_integer_default_values.size());
607  _node_integer_default_values[i] = default_value;
608  return i;
609  }
610 
611  libmesh_assert_equal_to(_node_integer_names.size(),
612  _node_integer_default_values.size());
613  _node_integer_names.push_back(std::move(name));
614  _node_integer_default_values.push_back(default_value);
615  if (allocate_data)
616  this->size_node_extra_integers();
617  return _node_integer_names.size()-1;
618 }

std::vector< unsigned int > libMesh::MeshBase::add_node_integers ( const std::vector< std::string > &  names,
bool  allocate_data = true,
const std::vector< dof_id_type > *  default_values = nullptr 
)
inherited

Register integer data (of type dof_id_type) to be added to each node in the mesh.

If the mesh already has nodes, data by default is allocated in each.

Newly allocated values for the new datum with name names[i] will be initialized to default_values[i], or to DofObject::invalid_id if default_values is null.

返回
The index numbers for the new data, and/or for existing data if data by some of the same names has already been added.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 622 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_node_integer_default_values, libMesh::MeshBase::_node_integer_names, libMesh::index_range(), libMesh::DofObject::invalid_id, libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::Quality::name() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::size_node_extra_integers().

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::merge_extra_integer_names() , 以及 libMesh::XdrIO::read_header().

625 {
626  libmesh_assert(!default_values || default_values->size() == names.size());
627  libmesh_assert_equal_to(_node_integer_names.size(), _node_integer_default_values.size());
628 
629  std::unordered_map<std::string, std::size_t> name_indices;
630  for (auto i : index_range(_node_integer_names))
631  name_indices[_node_integer_names[i]] = i;
632 
633  std::vector<unsigned int> returnval(names.size());
634 
635  bool added_an_integer = false;
636  for (auto i : index_range(names))
637  {
638  const std::string & name = names[i];
639  auto it = name_indices.find(name);
640  if (it != name_indices.end())
641  {
642  returnval[i] = it->second;
643  _node_integer_default_values[it->second] =
644  default_values ? (*default_values)[i] : DofObject::invalid_id;
645  }
646  else
647  {
648  returnval[i] = _node_integer_names.size();
649  name_indices[name] = returnval[i];
650  _node_integer_names.push_back(name);
651  _node_integer_default_values.push_back
652  (default_values ? (*default_values)[i] : DofObject::invalid_id);
653  added_an_integer = true;
654  }
655  }
656 
657  if (allocate_data && added_an_integer)
658  this->size_node_extra_integers();
659 
660  return returnval;
661 }

libMesh::DistributedMesh::_nodes
processor_id_type pid unsigned int level std::set< subdomain_id_type > ss const DofMap &dof_map LIBMESH_COMMA unsigned int dof_map LIBMESH_COMMA var_num unsigned char rflag processor_id_type pid const DofMap &dof_map LIBMESH_COMMA unsigned int dof_map LIBMESH_COMMA var_num DECLARE_NODE_ITERATORS(multi_evaluable_, std::vector< const DofMap * > dof_maps, dof_maps) protected dofobject_container< Node > _nodes

libMesh::DistributedMesh::add_node
virtual Node * add_node(Node *n) overridefinal
Add Node n to the end of the vertex array.
Definition: distributed_mesh.C:799
libMesh::libmesh_assert
libmesh_assert(ctx)
libMesh::Node::build
static std::unique_ptr< Node > build(const Node &n)
Definition: node.h:315
void libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::all_complete_order ( )
overridevirtualinherited

Converts a (conforming, non-refined) mesh with linear elements into a mesh with "complete" order elements, i.e.

elements which can store degrees of freedom on any vertex, edge, or face. For example, a mesh consisting of Tet4 or Tet10 will be converted to a mesh with Tet14 etc.

On distributed meshes we currently only support unpartitioned meshes (where we'll add every node in sync) or completely-partitioned meshes (where we'll sync nodes later); let's keep track to make sure we're not in any in-between state.

Loop over the low-ordered elements in the elements vector. First make sure they _are indeed low-order, and then replace them with an equivalent second-order element. Don't forget to delete the low-order element, or else it will leak!

实现了 libMesh::MeshBase.

在文件 unstructured_mesh.C 第 1518 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_is_prepared, libMesh::Elem::build(), libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), libMesh::Elem::default_order(), libMesh::FIRST, libMesh::DofObject::invalid_processor_id, libMesh::MeshBase::is_replicated(), libMesh::MeshBase::is_serial(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::libmesh_ignore(), libMesh::make_range(), libMesh::MeshBase::mesh_dimension(), libMesh::MeshBase::MeshCommunication, libMesh::MeshBase::n_elem(), libMesh::MeshBase::n_nodes(), libMesh::Elem::n_nodes(), libMesh::MeshBase::n_unpartitioned_elem(), libMesh::Elem::node_ptr(), libMesh::MeshBase::parallel_max_unique_id(), libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use(), libMesh::PRISM15, libMesh::PRISM18, libMesh::PRISM20, libMesh::PRISM21, libMesh::PRISM6, libMesh::DofObject::processor_id(), libMesh::PYRAMID13, libMesh::PYRAMID14, libMesh::PYRAMID18, libMesh::PYRAMID5, libMesh::MeshBase::renumber_nodes_and_elements(), libMesh::MeshBase::reserve_nodes(), libMesh::MeshBase::set_next_unique_id(), libMesh::TET10, libMesh::TET14, libMesh::TET4, libMesh::TRI3, libMesh::TRI6, libMesh::TRI7 , 以及 libMesh::Elem::type().

参考自 libMesh::MeshTools::Generation::build_cube().

1519 {
1520  // This function must be run on all processors at once
1521  parallel_object_only();
1522 
1523  /*
1524  * If the mesh is already complete ordered then we have nothing to
1525  * do ... but what if we have a hybrid mesh where some elements are
1526  * of complete order and others aren't? So we won't short-circuit
1527  * here.
1528  */
1529  LOG_SCOPE("all_complete_order()", "Mesh");
1530 
1531  /*
1532  * when the mesh is not prepared,
1533  * at least renumber the nodes and
1534  * elements, so that the node ids
1535  * are correct
1536  */
1537  if (!this->_is_prepared)
1538  this->renumber_nodes_and_elements ();
1539 
1540  /*
1541  * If the mesh is empty
1542  * then we have nothing to do
1543  */
1544  if (!this->n_elem())
1545  return;
1546 
1547  /*
1548  * this map helps in identifying second order
1549  * nodes. Namely, a higher-order node
1550  * - edge node
1551  * - face node
1552  * - bubble node
1553  * is uniquely defined through a set of adjacent
1554  * vertices. This set of adjacent vertices is
1555  * used to identify already added higher-order
1556  * nodes. We are safe to use node id's since we
1557  * make sure that these are correctly numbered.
1558  */
1559  std::map<std::vector<dof_id_type>, Node *> adj_vertices_to_co_nodes;
1560 
1561  /*
1562  * The maximum number of new second order nodes we might be adding,
1563  * for use when picking unique unique_id values later. This variable
1564  * is not used unless unique ids are enabled, so libmesh_ignore() it
1565  * to avoid warnings in that case.
1566  */
1567  unsigned int max_new_nodes_per_elem;
1568 
1569 #ifndef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
1570  libmesh_ignore(max_new_nodes_per_elem);
1571 #endif
1572 
1573 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
1574  unique_id_type max_unique_id = this->parallel_max_unique_id();
1575 #endif
1576 
1577  /*
1578  * for speed-up of the \p add_point() method, we
1579  * can reserve memory. Guess the number of additional
1580  * nodes for different dimensions
1581  */
1582  switch (this->mesh_dimension())
1583  {
1584  case 1:
1585  /*
1586  * in 1D, there can only be order-increase from Edge2
1587  * to Edge3. Something like 1/2 of n_nodes() have
1588  * to be added
1589  */
1590  max_new_nodes_per_elem = 3 - 2;
1591  this->reserve_nodes(static_cast<unsigned int>
1592  (1.5*static_cast<double>(this->n_nodes())));
1593  break;
1594 
1595  case 2:
1596  /*
1597  * in 2D, we typically refine from Tri6 to Tri7 (1.1667 times
1598  * the nodes) but might refine from Quad4 to Quad9
1599  * (2.25 times the nodes)
1600  */
1601  max_new_nodes_per_elem = 9 - 4;
1602  this->reserve_nodes(static_cast<unsigned int>
1603  (2*static_cast<double>(this->n_nodes())));
1604  break;
1605 
1606 
1607  case 3:
1608  /*
1609  * in 3D, we typically refine from Tet10 to Tet14 (factor = 1.4)
1610  * but may go Hex8 to Hex27 (something > 3). Since in 3D there
1611  * _are_ already quite some nodes, and since we do not want to
1612  * overburden the memory by a too conservative guess, use a
1613  * moderate bound
1614  */
1615  max_new_nodes_per_elem = 27 - 8;
1616  this->reserve_nodes(static_cast<unsigned int>
1617  (2.5*static_cast<double>(this->n_nodes())));
1618  break;
1619 
1620  default:
1621  // Hm?
1622  libmesh_error_msg("Unknown mesh dimension " << this->mesh_dimension());
1623  }
1624 
1631  dof_id_type n_unpartitioned_elem = 0,
1632  n_partitioned_elem = 0;
1633 
1640  for (auto & lo_elem : element_ptr_range())
1641  {
1642  // if it doesn't need mid-face elements added, continue
1643  if (lo_elem->type() != TRI7 &&
1644  lo_elem->type() != TET14 &&
1645  lo_elem->type() != PRISM20 &&
1646  lo_elem->type() != PRISM21 &&
1647  lo_elem->type() != PYRAMID18 &&
1648  lo_elem->default_order() != FIRST)
1649  continue;
1650 
1651  if (lo_elem->processor_id() == DofObject::invalid_processor_id)
1652  ++n_unpartitioned_elem;
1653  else
1654  ++n_partitioned_elem;
1655 
1656  /*
1657  * build the complete elem equivalent, add to
1658  * the new_elements list.
1659  */
1660  ElemType hi_type = TRI7;
1661  if (lo_elem->type() == TET10 || lo_elem->type() == TET4)
1662  hi_type = TET14;
1663  else if (lo_elem->type() == PRISM18 ||
1664  lo_elem->type() == PRISM15 ||
1665  lo_elem->type() == PRISM6)
1666  hi_type = PRISM21;
1667  else if (lo_elem->type() == PYRAMID14 ||
1668  lo_elem->type() == PYRAMID13 ||
1669  lo_elem->type() == PYRAMID5)
1670  hi_type = PYRAMID18;
1671  else
1672  libmesh_assert(lo_elem->type() == TRI6 || lo_elem->type() == TRI3);
1673 
1674  auto co_elem = Elem::build (hi_type);
1675 
1676  /*
1677  * By definition the initial vertices of the linear and
1678  * complete order element are identically numbered.
1679  * transfer these.
1680  */
1681  for (auto n : make_range(lo_elem->n_nodes()))
1682  co_elem->set_node(n) = lo_elem->node_ptr(n);
1683 
1684  transfer_elem(*lo_elem, std::move(co_elem),
1685 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
1686  max_unique_id, max_new_nodes_per_elem,
1687 #endif
1688  *this, adj_vertices_to_co_nodes);
1689  }
1690 
1691  // we can clear the map
1692  adj_vertices_to_co_nodes.clear();
1693 
1694 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
1695  const unique_id_type new_max_unique_id = max_unique_id +
1696  max_new_nodes_per_elem * this->n_elem();
1697  this->set_next_unique_id(new_max_unique_id);
1698 #endif
1699 
1700 
1701 
1702  // On a DistributedMesh our ghost node processor ids may be bad,
1703  // the ids of nodes touching remote elements may be inconsistent,
1704  // unique_ids of newly added non-local nodes remain unset, and our
1705  // partitioning of new nodes may not be well balanced.
1706  //
1707  // make_nodes_parallel_consistent() will fix all this.
1708  if (!this->is_replicated())
1709  {
1710  dof_id_type max_unpartitioned_elem = n_unpartitioned_elem;
1711  this->comm().max(max_unpartitioned_elem);
1712  if (max_unpartitioned_elem)
1713  {
1714  // We'd better be effectively serialized here. In theory we
1715  // could support more complicated cases but in practice we
1716  // only support "completely partitioned" and/or "serialized"
1717  if (!this->comm().verify(n_unpartitioned_elem) ||
1718  !this->comm().verify(n_partitioned_elem) ||
1719  !this->is_serial())
1720  libmesh_not_implemented();
1721  }
1722  else
1723  {
1724  MeshCommunication().make_nodes_parallel_consistent (*this);
1725  }
1726  }
1727 
1728  // renumber nodes, elements etc
1729  this->prepare_for_use();
1730 }
libMesh::ElemType
ElemType
Defines an enum for geometric element types.
Definition: enum_elem_type.h:33
libMesh::MeshBase::reserve_nodes
virtual void reserve_nodes(const dof_id_type nn)=0
Reserves space for a known number of nodes.

A Node is like a Point, but with more information.

virtual unique_id_type parallel_max_unique_id() const =0

virtual bool is_serial() const
Definition: mesh_base.h:201

Definition: enum_elem_type.h:77
libMesh::MeshBase::is_replicated
virtual bool is_replicated() const
Definition: mesh_base.h:223

Definition: enum_elem_type.h:46
libMesh::FIRST
Definition: enum_order.h:42
libMesh::PRISM15
Definition: enum_elem_type.h:51
libMesh::MeshBase::n_unpartitioned_elem
dof_id_type n_unpartitioned_elem() const
Definition: mesh_base.h:529
libMesh::PRISM21
Definition: enum_elem_type.h:78
libMesh::MeshBase::set_next_unique_id
virtual void set_next_unique_id(unique_id_type id)=0
Sets the next available unique id to be used.
libMesh::TRI3
Definition: enum_elem_type.h:39

void libmesh_ignore(const Args &...)

static const processor_id_type invalid_processor_id
An invalid processor_id to distinguish DoFs that have not been assigned to a processor.

libMesh::unique_id_type

libMesh::MeshBase::renumber_nodes_and_elements

After partitioning a mesh it is useful to renumber the nodes and elements so that they lie in contigu...
libMesh::dof_id_type
uint8_t dof_id_type
Definition: id_types.h:67
libMesh::PYRAMID14
Definition: enum_elem_type.h:55
void libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::all_first_order ( )
overridevirtualinherited

Converts a mesh with higher-order elements into a mesh with linear elements.

For example, a mesh consisting of Tet10 will be converted to a mesh with Tet4 etc.

Prepare to identify (and then delete) a bunch of no-longer-used nodes.

If the second order element had any boundary conditions they should be transferred to the first-order element. The old boundary conditions will be removed from the BoundaryInfo data structure by insert_elem.

实现了 libMesh::MeshBase.

在文件 unstructured_mesh.C 第 1130 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_is_prepared, libMesh::Elem::add_child(), libMesh::DofObject::add_extra_integers(), libMesh::Elem::build(), libMesh::Elem::child_ptr(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::copy_boundary_ids(), libMesh::MeshBase::delete_node(), libMesh::Elem::first_order_equivalent_type(), libMesh::MeshBase::get_boundary_info(), libMesh::MeshBase::insert_elem(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::MeshBase::max_node_id(), libMesh::Elem::n_vertices(), libMesh::Elem::node_id(), libMesh::Elem::parent(), libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use(), libMesh::DofObject::processor_id(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::regenerate_id_sets(), libMesh::remote_elem, libMesh::MeshBase::renumber_nodes_and_elements(), libMesh::Elem::replace_child(), libMesh::DofObject::set_extra_integer(), libMesh::DofObject::set_id(), libMesh::Elem::set_mapping_data(), libMesh::Elem::set_mapping_type(), libMesh::Elem::set_neighbor(), libMesh::Elem::set_node(), libMesh::Partitioner::set_node_processor_ids(), libMesh::Elem::set_p_level(), libMesh::Elem::set_p_refinement_flag(), libMesh::Elem::set_parent(), libMesh::Elem::set_refinement_flag(), libMesh::DofObject::set_unique_id() , 以及 libMesh::Elem::subdomain_id().

1131 {
1132  LOG_SCOPE("all_first_order()", "Mesh");
1133 
1134  /*
1135  * when the mesh is not prepared,
1136  * at least renumber the nodes and
1137  * elements, so that the node ids
1138  * are correct
1139  */
1140  if (!this->_is_prepared)
1141  this->renumber_nodes_and_elements ();
1142 
1146  std::vector<bool> node_touched_by_me(this->max_node_id(), false);
1147 
1148  // Loop over the high-ordered elements.
1149  // First make sure they _are_ indeed high-order, and then replace
1150  // them with an equivalent first-order element.
1151  for (auto & so_elem : element_ptr_range())
1152  {
1153  libmesh_assert(so_elem);
1154 
1155  /*
1156  * build the first-order equivalent, add to
1157  * the new_elements list.
1158  */
1159  auto lo_elem = Elem::build
1160  (Elem::first_order_equivalent_type
1161  (so_elem->type()), so_elem->parent());
1162 
1163  const unsigned short n_sides = so_elem->n_sides();
1164 
1165  for (unsigned short s=0; s != n_sides; ++s)
1166  if (so_elem->neighbor_ptr(s) == remote_elem)
1167  lo_elem->set_neighbor(s, const_cast<RemoteElem *>(remote_elem));
1168 
1169 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
1170  /*
1171  * Reset the parent links of any child elements
1172  */
1173  if (so_elem->has_children())
1174  for (unsigned int c = 0, nc = so_elem->n_children(); c != nc; ++c)
1175  {
1176  Elem * child = so_elem->child_ptr(c);
1177  if (child != remote_elem)
1178  child->set_parent(lo_elem.get());
1179  lo_elem->add_child(child, c);
1180  }
1181 
1182  /*
1183  * Reset the child link of any parent element
1184  */
1185  if (so_elem->parent())
1186  {
1187  unsigned int c =
1188  so_elem->parent()->which_child_am_i(so_elem);
1189  lo_elem->parent()->replace_child(lo_elem.get(), c);
1190  }
1191 
1192  /*
1193  * Copy as much data to the new element as makes sense
1194  */
1195  lo_elem->set_p_level(so_elem->p_level());
1196  lo_elem->set_refinement_flag(so_elem->refinement_flag());
1197  lo_elem->set_p_refinement_flag(so_elem->p_refinement_flag());
1198 #endif
1199 
1200  libmesh_assert_equal_to (lo_elem->n_vertices(), so_elem->n_vertices());
1201 
1202  /*
1203  * By definition the vertices of the linear and
1204  * second order element are identically numbered.
1205  * transfer these.
1206  */
1207  for (unsigned int v=0, snv=so_elem->n_vertices(); v < snv; v++)
1208  {
1209  lo_elem->set_node(v) = so_elem->node_ptr(v);
1210  node_touched_by_me[lo_elem->node_id(v)] = true;
1211  }
1212 
1213  /*
1214  * find_neighbors relies on remote_elem neighbor links being
1215  * properly maintained.
1216  */
1217  for (unsigned short s=0; s != n_sides; s++)
1218  {
1219  if (so_elem->neighbor_ptr(s) == remote_elem)
1220  lo_elem->set_neighbor(s, const_cast<RemoteElem*>(remote_elem));
1221  }
1222 
1229  this->get_boundary_info().copy_boundary_ids
1230  (this->get_boundary_info(), so_elem, lo_elem.get());
1231 
1232  /*
1233  * The new first-order element is ready.
1234  * Inserting it into the mesh will replace and delete
1235  * the second-order element.
1236  */
1237  lo_elem->set_id(so_elem->id());
1238 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
1239  lo_elem->set_unique_id(so_elem->unique_id());
1240 #endif
1241  lo_elem->processor_id() = so_elem->processor_id();
1242  lo_elem->subdomain_id() = so_elem->subdomain_id();
1243 
1244  const unsigned int nei = so_elem->n_extra_integers();
1245  lo_elem->add_extra_integers(nei);
1246  for (unsigned int i=0; i != nei; ++i)
1247  lo_elem->set_extra_integer(i, so_elem->get_extra_integer(i));
1248 
1249  // This is probably moot but shouldn't hurt
1250  lo_elem->set_mapping_type(so_elem->mapping_type());
1251  lo_elem->set_mapping_data(so_elem->mapping_data());
1252 
1253  this->insert_elem(std::move(lo_elem));
1254  }
1255 
1256  // Deleting nodes does not invalidate iterators, so this is safe.
1257  for (const auto & node : this->node_ptr_range())
1258  if (!node_touched_by_me[node->id()])
1259  this->delete_node(node);
1260 
1261  // If crazy people applied boundary info to non-vertices and then
1262  // deleted those non-vertices, we should make sure their boundary id
1263  // caches are correct.
1264  this->get_boundary_info().regenerate_id_sets();
1265 
1266  // On hanging nodes that used to also be second order nodes, we
1267  // might now have an invalid nodal processor_id()
1268  Partitioner::set_node_processor_ids(*this);
1269 
1270  // delete or renumber nodes if desired
1271  this->prepare_for_use();
1272 }
libMesh::MeshBase::get_boundary_info
const BoundaryInfo & get_boundary_info() const
The information about boundary ids on the mesh.

libMesh::Elem::set_parent

static void set_node_processor_ids(MeshBase &mesh)
This function is called after partitioning to set the processor IDs for the nodes.

static ElemType first_order_equivalent_type(const ElemType et)

libMesh::MeshBase::renumber_nodes_and_elements

void libMesh::MeshBase::all_second_order ( const bool  full_ordered = true)
inherited

Calls the range-based version of this function with a range consisting of all elements in the mesh.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 1533 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::all_second_order_range().

参考自 libMesh::MeshTools::Generation::build_cube().

1534 {
1535  this->all_second_order_range(this->element_ptr_range(), full_ordered);
1536 }
libMesh::MeshBase::all_second_order_range
virtual void all_second_order_range(const SimpleRange< element_iterator > &range, const bool full_ordered=true)=0
Converts a set of this Mesh&#39;s elements defined by range from FIRST order to SECOND order...
void libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::all_second_order_range ( const SimpleRange< element_iterator > &  range,
const bool  full_ordered = true 
)
overridevirtualinherited

Converts a (conforming, non-refined) mesh with linear elements into a mesh with second-order elements.

For example, a mesh consisting of Tet4 will be converted to a mesh with Tet10 etc.

注解
For some elements like Hex8 there exist two higher order equivalents, Hex20 and Hex27. When full_ordered is true (default), then Hex27 is built. Otherwise, Hex20 is built. The same holds obviously for Quad4, Prism6, etc.

On distributed meshes we currently only support unpartitioned meshes (where we'll add every node in sync) or completely-partitioned meshes (where we'll sync nodes later); let's keep track to make sure we're not in any in-between state.

Loop over the low-ordered elements in the elements vector. First make sure they _are indeed low-order, and then replace them with an equivalent second-order element. Don't forget to delete the low-order element, or else it will leak!

实现了 libMesh::MeshBase.

在文件 unstructured_mesh.C 第 1277 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_is_prepared, libMesh::SimpleRange< IndexType >::begin(), libMesh::Elem::build(), libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), libMesh::Elem::default_order(), libMesh::SimpleRange< IndexType >::end(), libMesh::Utility::enum_to_string(), libMesh::FIRST, libMesh::DofObject::invalid_processor_id, libMesh::MeshBase::is_replicated(), libMesh::MeshBase::is_serial(), libMesh::Elem::level(), libMesh::MeshBase::mesh_dimension(), libMesh::MeshBase::MeshCommunication, libMesh::MeshBase::n_elem(), libMesh::MeshBase::n_nodes(), libMesh::MeshBase::n_unpartitioned_elem(), libMesh::Elem::n_vertices(), libMesh::Elem::node_ptr(), libMesh::MeshBase::parallel_max_unique_id(), libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use(), libMesh::DofObject::processor_id(), libMesh::MeshBase::renumber_nodes_and_elements(), libMesh::MeshBase::reserve_nodes(), libMesh::SECOND, libMesh::Elem::second_order_equivalent_type(), libMesh::MeshBase::set_next_unique_id() , 以及 libMesh::Elem::type().

1279 {
1280  // This function must be run on all processors at once
1281  parallel_object_only();
1282 
1283  LOG_SCOPE("all_second_order_range()", "Mesh");
1284 
1285  /*
1286  * when the mesh is not prepared,
1287  * at least renumber the nodes and
1288  * elements, so that the node ids
1289  * are correct
1290  */
1291  if (!this->_is_prepared)
1292  this->renumber_nodes_and_elements ();
1293 
1294  /*
1295  * If the mesh is empty
1296  * then we have nothing to do
1297  */
1298  if (!this->n_elem())
1299  return;
1300 
1301  // If every element in the range _on every proc_ is already second
1302  // order then we have nothing to do. However, if any proc has some
1303  // first-order elements in the range, then _all_ processors need to
1304  // continue this function because it is parallel_only(). Note:
1305  // std::all_of() returns true for an empty range, which can happen
1306  // for example in the DistributedMesh case when there are more
1307  // processors than elements. In the case of an empty range we
1308  // therefore set already_second_order to true on that proc.
1309  bool already_second_order =
1310  std::all_of(range.begin(), range.end(),
1311  [](const auto & elem){ return elem->default_order() == SECOND; });
1312 
1313  // Check with other processors and possibly return early
1314  this->comm().min(already_second_order);
1315  if (already_second_order)
1316  return;
1317 
1318  /*
1319  * this map helps in identifying second order
1320  * nodes. Namely, a second-order node:
1321  * - edge node
1322  * - face node
1323  * - bubble node
1324  * is uniquely defined through a set of adjacent
1325  * vertices. This set of adjacent vertices is
1326  * used to identify already added higher-order
1327  * nodes. We are safe to use node id's since we
1328  * make sure that these are correctly numbered.
1329  */
1330  std::map<std::vector<dof_id_type>, Node *> adj_vertices_to_so_nodes;
1331 
1332  /*
1333  * The maximum number of new second order nodes we might be adding,
1334  * for use when picking unique unique_id values later. This variable
1335  * is not used unless unique ids are enabled.
1336  */
1337 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
1338  unsigned int max_new_nodes_per_elem;
1339 
1340  unique_id_type max_unique_id = this->parallel_max_unique_id();
1341 #endif
1342 
1343  /*
1344  * For speed-up of the \p add_point() method, we
1345  * can reserve memory. Guess the number of additional
1346  * nodes based on the element spatial dimensions and the
1347  * total number of nodes in the mesh as an upper bound.
1348  */
1349  switch (this->mesh_dimension())
1350  {
1351  case 1:
1352  /*
1353  * in 1D, there can only be order-increase from Edge2
1354  * to Edge3. Something like 1/2 of n_nodes() have
1355  * to be added
1356  */
1357 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
1358  max_new_nodes_per_elem = 3 - 2;
1359 #endif
1360  this->reserve_nodes(static_cast<unsigned int>
1361  (1.5*static_cast<double>(this->n_nodes())));
1362  break;
1363 
1364  case 2:
1365  /*
1366  * in 2D, either refine from Tri3 to Tri6 (double the nodes)
1367  * or from Quad4 to Quad8 (again, double) or Quad9 (2.25 that much)
1368  */
1369 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
1370  max_new_nodes_per_elem = 9 - 4;
1371 #endif
1372  this->reserve_nodes(static_cast<unsigned int>
1373  (2*static_cast<double>(this->n_nodes())));
1374  break;
1375 
1376 
1377  case 3:
1378  /*
1379  * in 3D, either refine from Tet4 to Tet10 (factor = 2.5) up to
1380  * Hex8 to Hex27 (something > 3). Since in 3D there _are_ already
1381  * quite some nodes, and since we do not want to overburden the memory by
1382  * a too conservative guess, use the lower bound
1383  */
1384 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
1385  max_new_nodes_per_elem = 27 - 8;
1386 #endif
1387  this->reserve_nodes(static_cast<unsigned int>
1388  (2.5*static_cast<double>(this->n_nodes())));
1389  break;
1390 
1391  default:
1392  // Hm?
1393  libmesh_error_msg("Unknown mesh dimension " << this->mesh_dimension());
1394  }
1395 
1396 
1397 
1398  /*
1399  * form a vector that will hold the node id's of
1400  * the vertices that are adjacent to the son-th
1401  * second-order node. Pull this outside of the
1402  * loop so that silly compilers don't repeatedly
1403  * create and destroy the vector.
1404  */
1405  std::vector<dof_id_type> adjacent_vertices_ids;
1406 
1413  dof_id_type n_unpartitioned_elem = 0,
1414  n_partitioned_elem = 0;
1415 
1422  for (auto & lo_elem : range)
1423  {
1424  // Skip elements in the range that are already SECOND-order.
1425  // Ordinarily one does not have a mixture of FIRST and
1426  // SECOND-order elements in an all-2D or all-3D mesh, since
1427  // FIRST and SECOND-order elements can't be (conforming)
1428  // neighbors, but in a mixed-dimension element mesh, this is
1429  // possible.
1430  if (lo_elem->default_order() == SECOND)
1431  continue;
1432 
1433  // Otherwise, we only know how to handle FIRST-order elements
1434  libmesh_error_msg_if(lo_elem->default_order() != FIRST,
1435  "ERROR: This is not a linear element: type=" << Utility::enum_to_string(lo_elem->type()));
1436 
1437  // this does _not_ work for refined elements
1438  libmesh_assert_equal_to (lo_elem->level (), 0);
1439 
1440  if (lo_elem->processor_id() == DofObject::invalid_processor_id)
1441  ++n_unpartitioned_elem;
1442  else
1443  ++n_partitioned_elem;
1444 
1445  /*
1446  * build the second-order equivalent, add to
1447  * the new_elements list. Note that this here
1448  * is the only point where \p full_ordered
1449  * is necessary. The remaining code works well
1450  * for either type of second-order equivalent, e.g.
1451  * Hex20 or Hex27, as equivalents for Hex8
1452  */
1453  auto so_elem =
1454  Elem::build (Elem::second_order_equivalent_type(lo_elem->type(),
1455  full_ordered));
1456 
1457  libmesh_assert_equal_to (lo_elem->n_vertices(), so_elem->n_vertices());
1458 
1459 
1460  /*
1461  * By definition the vertices of the linear and
1462  * second order element are identically numbered.
1463  * transfer these.
1464  */
1465  for (unsigned int v=0, lnv=lo_elem->n_vertices(); v < lnv; v++)
1466  so_elem->set_node(v) = lo_elem->node_ptr(v);
1467 
1468  transfer_elem(*lo_elem, std::move(so_elem),
1469 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
1470  max_unique_id, max_new_nodes_per_elem,
1471 #endif
1472  *this, adj_vertices_to_so_nodes);
1473  } // end for (auto & lo_elem : range)
1474 
1475  // we can clear the map
1476  adj_vertices_to_so_nodes.clear();
1477 
1478 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
1479  const unique_id_type new_max_unique_id = max_unique_id +
1480  max_new_nodes_per_elem * this->n_elem();
1481  this->set_next_unique_id(new_max_unique_id);
1482 #endif
1483 
1484 
1485 
1486  // On a DistributedMesh our ghost node processor ids may be bad,
1487  // the ids of nodes touching remote elements may be inconsistent,
1488  // unique_ids of newly added non-local nodes remain unset, and our
1489  // partitioning of new nodes may not be well balanced.
1490  //
1491  // make_nodes_parallel_consistent() will fix all this.
1492  if (!this->is_replicated())
1493  {
1494  dof_id_type max_unpartitioned_elem = n_unpartitioned_elem;
1495  this->comm().max(max_unpartitioned_elem);
1496  if (max_unpartitioned_elem)
1497  {
1498  // We'd better be effectively serialized here. In theory we
1499  // could support more complicated cases but in practice we
1500  // only support "completely partitioned" and/or "serialized"
1501  if (!this->comm().verify(n_unpartitioned_elem) ||
1502  !this->comm().verify(n_partitioned_elem) ||
1503  !this->is_serial())
1504  libmesh_not_implemented();
1505  }
1506  else
1507  {
1508  MeshCommunication().make_nodes_parallel_consistent (*this);
1509  }
1510  }
1511 
1512  // renumber nodes, elements etc
1513  this->prepare_for_use();
1514 }
libMesh::SimpleRange::end
IndexType end() const
Definition: simple_range.h:43
libMesh::SimpleRange::begin
IndexType begin() const
Definition: simple_range.h:41

Definition: enum_order.h:42

void libMesh::MeshBase::allow_remote_element_removal ( bool  allow)
inlineinherited

If false is passed in then this mesh will no longer have remote elements deleted when being prepared for use; i.e.

even a DistributedMesh will remain (if it is already) serialized. This may adversely affect performance and memory use.

void libMesh::MeshBase::allow_renumbering ( bool  allow)
inlineinherited

If false is passed in then this mesh will no longer be renumbered when being prepared for use.

This may slightly adversely affect performance during subsequent element access, particularly when using a distributed mesh.

Important! When allow_renumbering(false) is set, ReplicatedMesh::n_elem() and ReplicatedMesh::n_nodes() will return wrong values whenever adaptive refinement is followed by adaptive coarsening. (Uniform refinement followed by uniform coarsening is OK.) This is due to the fact that n_elem() and n_nodes() are currently O(1) functions that just return the size of the respective underlying vectors, and this size is wrong when the numbering includes "gaps" from nodes and elements that have been deleted. We plan to implement a caching mechanism in the near future that will fix this incorrect behavior.

在文件 mesh_base.h 第 1169 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements.

参考自 libMesh::UniformRefinementEstimator::_estimate_error(), libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::copy_nodes_and_elements(), libMesh::AdjointRefinementEstimator::estimate_error(), libMesh::PetscDMWrapper::init_and_attach_petscdm(), libMesh::ErrorVector::plot_error(), libMesh::NameBasedIO::read() , 以及 libMesh::GMVIO::read().

1169 { _skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements = !allow; }
libMesh::MeshBase::_skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements
bool _skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements
If this is true then renumbering will be kept to a minimum.
Definition: mesh_base.h:1833

inlineinherited

在文件 mesh_base.h 第 1170 行定义.

参考自 libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::copy_nodes_and_elements(), libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use() , 以及 libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::read().

void libMesh::MeshBase::cache_elem_data ( )
inherited

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 1655 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_elem_dims, libMesh::MeshBase::_mesh_subdomains, libMesh::MeshBase::_spatial_dimension, libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), libMesh::MeshBase::is_serial() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::mesh_dimension().

参考自 libMesh::MeshBase::cache_elem_dims(), libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::set_elem_dimensions().

1656 {
1657  // This requires an inspection on every processor
1658  parallel_object_only();
1659 
1660  // Need to clear _elem_dims first in case all elements of a
1661  // particular dimension have been deleted.
1662  _elem_dims.clear();
1663  _mesh_subdomains.clear();
1664 
1665  for (const auto & elem : this->active_element_ptr_range())
1666  {
1667  _elem_dims.insert(cast_int<unsigned char>(elem->dim()));
1668  _mesh_subdomains.insert(elem->subdomain_id());
1669  }
1670 
1671  if (!this->is_serial())
1672  {
1673  // Some different dimension elements may only live on other processors
1674  this->comm().set_union(_elem_dims);
1675  this->comm().set_union(_mesh_subdomains);
1676  }
1677 
1678  // If the largest element dimension found is larger than the current
1679  // _spatial_dimension, increase _spatial_dimension.
1680  unsigned int max_dim = this->mesh_dimension();
1681  if (max_dim > _spatial_dimension)
1682  _spatial_dimension = cast_int<unsigned char>(max_dim);
1683 
1684  // _spatial_dimension may need to increase from 1->2 or 2->3 if the
1685  // mesh is full of 1D elements but they are not x-aligned, or the
1686  // mesh is full of 2D elements but they are not in the x-y plane.
1687  // If the mesh is x-aligned or x-y planar, we will end up checking
1688  // every node's coordinates and not breaking out of the loop
1689  // early...
1690 #if LIBMESH_DIM > 1
1691  if (_spatial_dimension < 3)
1692  {
1693  for (const auto & node : this->node_ptr_range())
1694  {
1695  // Note: the exact floating point comparison is intentional,
1696  // we don't want to get tripped up by tolerances.
1697  if ((*node)(1) != 0.)
1698  {
1699  _spatial_dimension = 2;
1700 #if LIBMESH_DIM == 2
1701  // If libmesh is compiled in 2D mode, this is the
1702  // largest spatial dimension possible so we can break
1703  // out.
1704  break;
1705 #endif
1706  }
1707 
1708 #if LIBMESH_DIM > 2
1709  if ((*node)(2) != 0.)
1710  {
1711  // Spatial dimension can't get any higher than this, so
1712  // we can break out.
1713  _spatial_dimension = 3;
1714  break;
1715  }
1716 #endif
1717  }
1718  }
1719 #endif // LIBMESH_DIM > 1
1720 }

We cache the subdomain ids of the elements present in the mesh.

libMesh::MeshBase::cache_elem_data
void cache_elem_data()
Definition: mesh_base.C:1655
void libMesh::MeshBase::change_elemset_code ( dof_id_type  old_code,
dof_id_type  new_code 
)
inherited

Replace elemset code "old_code" with "new_code".

This function loops over all elements and changes the extra integer corresponding to the "elemset_code" label, and updates the _elemset_codes and _elemset_codes_inverse_map members. Does not change the elemset ids of any of the sets.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 404 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_elemset_codes, libMesh::MeshBase::_elemset_codes_inverse_map, libMesh::MeshBase::add_elemset_code(), libMesh::MeshBase::get_elem_integer_index() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::has_elem_integer().

405 {
406  // Look up elemset ids for old_code
407  auto it = _elemset_codes.find(old_code);
408 
409  // If we don't have the old_code, then do nothing. Alternatively, we
410  // could throw an error since trying to change an elemset code you
411  // don't have could indicate there's a problem...
412  if (it == _elemset_codes.end())
413  return;
414 
415  // Make copy of the set of elemset ids. We are not changing these,
416  // only updating the elemset code it corresponds to.
417  elemset_type id_set_copy = *(it->second);
418 
419  // Look up the corresponding entry in the inverse map. Note: we want
420  // the iterator because we are going to remove it.
421  auto inverse_it = _elemset_codes_inverse_map.find(id_set_copy);
422  libmesh_error_msg_if(inverse_it == _elemset_codes_inverse_map.end(),
423  "Expected _elemset_codes_inverse_map entry for elemset code " << old_code);
424 
425  // Erase entry from inverse map
426  _elemset_codes_inverse_map.erase(inverse_it);
427 
428  // Erase entry from forward map
429  _elemset_codes.erase(it);
430 
431  // Add new code with original set of ids.
432  this->add_elemset_code(new_code, id_set_copy);
433 
434  // We can't update any actual elemset codes if there is no extra integer defined for it.
435  if (!this->has_elem_integer("elemset_code"))
436  return;
437 
438  // Get index of elemset_code extra integer
439  unsigned int elemset_index = this->get_elem_integer_index("elemset_code");
440 
441  // Loop over all elems and update code
442  for (auto & elem : this->element_ptr_range())
443  {
444  dof_id_type elemset_code =
445  elem->get_extra_integer(elemset_index);
446 
447  if (elemset_code == old_code)
448  elem->set_extra_integer(elemset_index, new_code);
449  }
450 }

void libMesh::MeshBase::change_elemset_id ( elemset_id_type  old_id,
elemset_id_type  new_id 
)
inherited

Replace elemset id "old_id" with "new_id".

Does not change any of the elemset codes, so does not need to loop over the elements themselves.

在文件 mesh_base.C 第 452 行定义.

参考 libMesh::MeshBase::_all_elemset_ids, libMesh::MeshBase::_elemset_codes , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::_elemset_codes_inverse_map.

453 {
454  // Early return if we don't have old_id
455  if (!_all_elemset_ids.count(old_id))
456  return;
457 
458  // Throw an error if the new_id is already used
459  libmesh_error_msg_if(_all_elemset_ids.count(new_id),
460  "Cannot change elemset id " << old_id <<
461  " to " << new_id << ", " << new_id << " already exists.");
462 
463  // We will build up a new version of the inverse map so we can iterate over
464  // the current one without invalidating anything.
465  std::map<MeshBase::elemset_type, dof_id_type> new_elemset_codes_inverse_map;
466  for (const auto & [id_set, elemset_code] : _elemset_codes_inverse_map)
467  {
468  auto id_set_copy = id_set;
469  if (id_set_copy.count(old_id))
470  {
471  // Remove old_id, insert new_id
472  id_set_copy.erase(old_id);
473  id_set_copy.insert(new_id);
474  }
475 
476  // Store in new version of map
477  new_elemset_codes_inverse_map.emplace(id_set_copy, elemset_code);
478  }
479 
480  // Swap existing map with newly-built one
481  _elemset_codes_inverse_map.swap(new_elemset_codes_inverse_map);
482 
483  // Reconstruct _elemset_codes map
484  _elemset_codes.clear();
485  for (const auto & [id_set, elemset_code] : _elemset_codes_inverse_map)
486  _elemset_codes.emplace(elemset_code, &id_set);
487 
488  // Update _all_elemset_ids
489  _all_elemset_ids.erase(old_id);
490  _all_elemset_ids.insert(new_id);
491 }

overridevirtualinherited

Clear all internal data.

重载 libMesh::MeshBase .

在文件 distributed_mesh.C 第 989 行定义.

参考 libMesh::DistributedMesh::_deleted_coarse_elements, libMesh::DistributedMesh::_is_serial, libMesh::DistributedMesh::_is_serial_on_proc_0, libMesh::DistributedMesh::_max_node_id, libMesh::DistributedMesh::_n_nodes, libMesh::DistributedMesh::_next_free_local_node_id, libMesh::DistributedMesh::_next_free_unpartitioned_node_id, libMesh::MeshBase::clear(), libMesh::DistributedMesh::clear_elems(), libMesh::ParallelObject::n_processors() , 以及 libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id().

参考自 libMesh::DistributedMesh::~DistributedMesh().

990 {
991  // Call parent clear function
992  MeshBase::clear();
993 
994  // Clear our elements and nodes
995  // There is no need to remove them from
996  // the BoundaryInfo data structure since we
997  // already cleared it.
998  this->DistributedMesh::clear_elems();
999 
1000  for (auto & node : _nodes)
1001  delete node;
1002 
1003  _nodes.clear();
1004 
1005  // We're no longer distributed if we were before
1006  _is_serial = true;
1007  _is_serial_on_proc_0 = true;
1008 
1009  // We deleted a ton of coarse elements, but their nodes got deleted too so
1010  // all is copacetic.
1011  _deleted_coarse_elements = false;
1012 
1013  // Correct our caches
1014  _n_nodes = 0;
1015  _max_node_id = 0;
1016  _next_free_local_node_id = this->processor_id();
1017  _next_free_unpartitioned_node_id = this->n_processors();
1018 }

bool libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::contract ( )
overridevirtualinherited

Delete subactive (i.e.

children of coarsened) elements. This removes all elements descended from currently active elements in the mesh.

实现了 libMesh::MeshBase.

在文件 unstructured_mesh.C 第 1067 行定义.

参考 libMesh::as_range(), libMesh::MeshBase::clear_point_locator(), libMesh::MeshBase::delete_elem(), libMesh::MeshBase::ghosting_functors_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::ghosting_functors_end(), libMesh::libmesh_assert() , 以及 libMesh::MeshBase::renumber_nodes_and_elements().

1068 {
1069  LOG_SCOPE ("contract()", "Mesh");
1070 
1071  // Flag indicating if this call actually changes the mesh
1072  bool mesh_changed = false;
1073 
1074 #ifdef DEBUG
1075  for (const auto & elem : this->element_ptr_range())
1076  libmesh_assert(elem->active() || elem->subactive() || elem->ancestor());
1077 #endif
1078 
1079  // Loop over the elements.
1080  for (auto & elem : this->element_ptr_range())
1081  {
1082  // Delete all the subactive ones
1083  if (elem->subactive())
1084  {
1085  // No level-0 element should be subactive.
1086  // Note that we CAN'T test elem->level(), as that
1087  // touches elem->parent()->dim(), and elem->parent()
1088  // might have already been deleted!
1089  libmesh_assert(elem->parent());
1090 
1091  // Delete the element
1092  // This just sets a pointer to nullptr, and doesn't
1093  // invalidate any iterators
1094  this->delete_elem(elem);
1095 
1096  // the mesh has certainly changed
1097  mesh_changed = true;
1098  }
1099  else
1100  {
1101  // Compress all the active ones
1102  if (elem->active())
1103  elem->contract();
1104  else
1105  libmesh_assert (elem->ancestor());
1106  }
1107  }
1108 
1109  // Strip any newly-created nullptr voids out of the element array
1110  this->renumber_nodes_and_elements();
1111 
1112  // FIXME: Need to understand why deleting subactive children
1113  // invalidates the point locator. For now we will clear it explicitly
1114  this->clear_point_locator();
1115 
1116  // Allow our GhostingFunctor objects to reinit if necessary.
1117  for (auto & gf : as_range(this->ghosting_functors_begin(),
1118  this->ghosting_functors_end()))
1119  {
1120  libmesh_assert(gf);
1121  gf->mesh_reinit();
1122  }
1123 
1124  return mesh_changed;
1125 }
